summary: Email chain among prosecutors discussing a draft response to a Rule 16/Brady letter from the defense in the Epstein case. The correspondence shows coordination between Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding discovery matters and scheduling a meeting to discuss the draft.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who needs to add comments to a draft letter before discussion.

persons.name: Chris
persons.context: Author of an October 13, 2020 letter to which the prosecutors are drafting a response regarding Rule 16/Brady matters.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney on opposite sides of a legal case, with Chris's letter prompting the prosecutors' draft response.

events.title: Defense Rule 16/Brady Letter
events.description: Chris, a defense attorney, sends a letter to prosecutors regarding Rule 16 and Brady discovery obligations.

events.title: Scheduled Prosecution Meeting
events.description: Prosecutors schedule a meeting to discuss a draft response to the defense's Rule 16/Brady letter.

locations.name: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
locations.address: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007

keyFacts: Prosecutors are drafting a response to a Rule 16/Brady letter from defense attorney Chris dated October 13, 2020.
The email chain shows internal coordination among prosecutors, including scheduling a meeting to discuss the draft response.
The correspondence indicates ongoing discovery and Brady obligation discussions in the legal proceedings.
The document is an internal prosecution email, not a formal court filing or transcript.
